name: HIP 57274
scenarioDescription:
The HIP 57274 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HIP 57274 is a star with 0.29 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.78 times its radius. It is located 84.41 light years away from the solar system.

HIP 57274 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HIP 57274 system


HIP 57274 b

HIP 57274 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HIP 57274 b is 6.36 times the mass of Earth. At 6.36 Earth masses, HIP 57274 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.


HIP 57274 c

HIP 57274 c was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.18 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HIP 57274 c is 130.06835999999998 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HIP 57274 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HIP 57274 d

HIP 57274 d was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.01 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HIP 57274 d is 167.49059999999997 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HIP 57274 d is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HIP 57274, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by W. M. Keck Observatory.
